desc: A schema describing a particular JSON format
title: Schema

type.title: Type (type)

desc_enum.map: Nested mapping of key/value pairs (a.k.a. 'properties').  You must also have a 'mapping' property which is itself a sequence containing a single schema definition
desc_enum.seq: Nested sequence of items ('array' in many languages).  You must also have a 'sequence' property which is itself a sequence containing a single schema definition

type.desc: The datatype of the property (e.g. number, boolean, etc), used for determining the semantics of the variable described

title.desc: A user-friendly title for the property
title.title: Title (title)

id.desc: An identifier used to reference this property using the 'idref' property
id.title: Identifier (id)

desc.desc: A description for use in documentation and context help
desc.title: Description (desc)

user_key.desc: Key for properties named by the user.  Use only when type=map, and ensure there's a corresponding property schema in the mapping
user_key.title: User named key (user_key)

idref.desc: Reference to a schema segment with the given 'id' property.  The 'type' attribute must be set to 'idref'.
idref.title: Identifier reference (idref)

enum.desc: Enumerated sequence of valid values for this property.
enum.title: Enumeration (enum)

additionalProperties.desc: A mapping containing a description for each possible value listed in the enumeration (enum) property.  Used for documentation and context help.
additionalProperties.title: Description for enum value

required.desc: If 'true', then this property must always be present
required.title: Required property? (required)

mapping.desc: A mapping containing schema segments describing each property in the mapping.  The 'type' property must be set to 'map' to use this property.
mapping.title: Mapping (mapping)

sequence.desc: A sequence containing a single schema segment
sequence.title: Sequence (sequence)
